column2: Adam, Seth, Enosh,
column3: Adamu na Seti na Enoshi,
column4: Adam , Seth, Enosh,

column2: Kenan, Mahalalel, Jared,
column3: na Kenani na Mahalaleli na Yaredi,
column4: Qénân, Mahalaléel, Yéred,

column2: Enoch, Methuselah, Lamech, Noah.
column3: na Henoki na Metusela na Lameki,
column4: Hénok, Mathusalem, Lémek,

column2: The sons of Noah: Shem, Ham and Japheth.
column3: na Nowa na Shemu na Hamu na Yafeti.
column4: Noé, Sem, Cham et Japhet.

column2: The sons of Japheth: Gomer, Magog, Madai, Javan, Tubal, Meshek and Tiras.
column3: Aba Yafeti ni Gomeri na Magogi na Madayi na Yavani na Tubalu na Mesheki na Tirasi.
column4: Fils de Japhet : Gomer, Magog, Madaï, Yavân, Toubal, Méshek et Tiras.

column2: The sons of Gomer: Ashkenaz, Riphath and Togarmah.
column3: Aba Gomeri ni Ashikenazi na Rifati na Togaruma.
column4: Fils de Gomer : Ashkenaz, Diphath et Togarma.

column2: The sons of Javan: Elishah, Tarshish, the Kittites and the Rodanites.
column3: Aba Yavani ni Elisha na Tarushishi na Kitimu na Dodanimu.
column4: Fils de Yavân : Elisha, Tarsis, Kittim et Dodanim .

column2: The sons of Ham: Cush, Egypt, Put and Canaan.
column3: Aba Hamu ni Kushi na Misirayimu na Puti na Kanani.
column4: Fils de Cham : Koush, Mitsraïm, Pouth et Canaan.

column2: The sons of Cush: Seba, Havilah, Sabta, Raamah and Sabteka. The sons of Raamah: Sheba and Dedan.
column3: Aba Kushi ni Seba na Havila na Sabuta na Rama na Sabuteka. Bene Rama ni Sheba na Dedani.
column4: Fils de Koush : Seba, Havila, Sabta, Raema et Sabteka. Fils de Raema : Sheba et Dedân.

column2: Cush was the father of Nimrod, who became a mighty warrior on earth.
column3: Kandi Kushi yavyaye na Nimurodi: ni we wa mbere yabaye cīhabugabo mw isi.
column4: Koush fut le père de Nimrod qui se mit à exercer un grand pouvoir sur la terre.

column2: Egypt was the father of the Ludites, Anamites, Lehabites, Naphtuhites,
column3: Misirayimu yakomōtsweko n’Abaludi n’Abanami n’Abalehabi n’Abanafutuhi,
column4: Mitsraïm fut l’ancêtre des Loudim, des Anamim, des Lehabim, des Naphtouim,

column2: Pathrusites, Kasluhites (from whom the Philistines came) and Caphtorites.
column3: n’Abapatirusi n’Abakasiluhi (ni bo bākomōtsweko n’Abafilisitiya), kandi yakomōtsweko n’ Abakafutori.
column4: des Patrousim, des Kaslouhim – dont sont issus les Philistins – et des Crétois.

column2: Canaan was the father of Sidon his firstborn, and of the Hittites,
column3: Kanani yavyaye imfura yiwe Sidoni, akurikizako Heti:
column4: Canaan eut pour fils Sidon, son aîné, et Heth.

column2: Jebusites, Amorites, Girgashites,
column3: kandi Kanani ni we yakomōtsweko n’Abayebusi n’Abamori n’Abagirugashi,
column4: De lui descendent les Yebousiens, les Amoréens, les Guirgasiens,

column2: Hivites, Arkites, Sinites,
column3: n’Abahiwi n’Abaruki n’Abasini,
column4: les Héviens, les Arqiens, les Siniens,

column2: Arvadites, Zemarites and Hamathites.
column3: n’Abaruvadi n’Abasemari n’Abahamati.
column4: les Arvadiens, les Tsemariens et les Hamathiens.

column2: The sons of Shem: Elam, Ashur, Arphaxad, Lud and Aram. The sons of Aram: Uz, Hul, Gether and Meshek.
column3: Aba Shemu ni Elamu na Ashuri na Arupakisadi na Ludi na Aramu na Uzi na Huli na Geteri na Mesheki.
column4: Les descendants de Sem furent : Elam, Assour, Arpakshad, Loud et Aram. Les descendants d’Aram furent : Outs, Houl, Guéter et Méshek.

column2: Arphaxad was the father of Shelah, and Shelah the father of Eber.
column3: Arupakisadi yavyaye Shela; Shela yavyaye Eberi.
column4: Arpakshad eut pour fils Shélah, et Shélah eut pour fils Héber.

column2: Two sons were born to Eber: One was named Peleg, because in his time the earth was divided; his brother was named Joktan.
column3: Eberi yavyaye abahungu babiri: umwe yitwa Pelegi, kuko mu gihe ciwe ari ho isi yagabanganirijwe; murumuna we yitwa Yokitani.
column4: Héber eut deux fils : l’un s’appelait Péleg (Partage) parce que de son temps la terre fut partagée, et son frère s’appelait Yoqtân.

column2: Joktan was the father of Almodad, Sheleph, Hazarmaveth, Jerah,
column3: Yokitani yavyaye Alumodadi na Shelefu na Hasarumaweti na Yera,
column4: Yoqtân eut pour fils Almodad, Shéleph, Hatsarmaveth, Yérah,

column2: Hadoram, Uzal, Diklah,
column3: na Hadoramu na Uzalu na Dikila,
column4: Hadoram, Ouzal, Diqla,

column2: Obal, Abimael, Sheba,
column3: na Ebali na Abimayeli na Sheba,
column4: Obal , Abimaël, Saba,

column2: Ophir, Havilah and Jobab. All these were sons of Joktan.
column3: na Ofiru na Havila na Yobabu; abo bose ni bene Yokitani.
column4: Ophir, Havila et Yobab. Tous ceux-là étaient des descendants de Yoqtân.

column2: Shem, Arphaxad, Shelah,
column3: Shemu na Arupakisadi na Shela,
column4: Sem , Arpakshad , Shélah,

column2: Eber, Peleg, Reu,
column3: na Eberi na Pelegi na Reyu,
column4: Héber, Péleg, Reou,

column2: Serug, Nahor, Terah
column3: na Serugi na Nahori na Tera,
column4: Seroug, Nahor, Térah,

column2: and Abram (that is, Abraham).
column3: na Aburamu, ari we Aburahamu.
column4: Abram, c’est-à-dire Abraham.

column2: The sons of Abraham: Isaac and Ishmael.
column3: Bene Aburahamu ni Isaka na Ishimayeli.
column4: Abraham eut pour fils : Isaac et Ismaël.

column2: These were their descendants: Nebaioth the firstborn of Ishmael, Kedar, Adbeel, Mibsam,
column3: Uru ni rwo ruvyaro rwabo: imfura ya Ishimayeli ni Nebayoti, hakurikira Kedari na Adibeli na Mibusamu,
column4: Voici leur postérité : le fils aîné d’Ismaël s’appelait Nebayoth, puis viennent Qédar, Adbéel, Mibsam,

column2: Mishma, Dumah, Massa, Hadad, Tema,
column3: na Mishima na Duma na Masa na Hadadi na Tema,
column4: Mishma, Douma, Massa, Hadad, Téma,

column2: Jetur, Naphish and Kedemah. These were the sons of Ishmael.
column3: na Yeturi na Nafishi na Kedema; abo ni bo bana ba Ishimayeli.
column4: Yetour, Naphish et Qedma. Tels sont les fils d’Ismaël.

column2: The sons born to Keturah, Abraham’s concubine: Zimran, Jokshan, Medan, Midian, Ishbak and Shuah. The sons of Jokshan: Sheba and Dedan.
column3: Aba ni bo bana Ketura, incoreke ya Aburahamu, yavyaranye na we: avyara Zimurani na Yokishani na Medani na Midiyani na Yishibaki na Shuwa. Bene Yokishani ni Sheba na Dedani.
column4: Qetoura , épouse de second rang d’Abraham, donna naissance à Zimrân, Yoqshân, Medân, Madian, Yishbaq et Shouah. Fils de Yoqshân : Saba et Dedân.

column2: The sons of Midian: Ephah, Epher, Hanok, Abida and Eldaah. All these were descendants of Keturah.
column3: Bene Midiyani ni Efa na Eferi na Hanoki na Abida na Eludaya. Abo bose n’uruvyaro rwa Ketura.
column4: Fils de Madian : Epha, Epher, Hénok, Abida et Eldaa. Tous ceux-là sont les descendants de Qetoura.

column2: Abraham was the father of Isaac. The sons of Isaac: Esau and Israel.
column3: Aburahamu yavyaye Isaka. Bene Isaka ni Esau na Isirayeli.
column4: Abraham eut pour fils Isaac qui eut pour fils : Esaü et Israël .

column2: The sons of Esau: Eliphaz, Reuel, Jeush, Jalam and Korah.
column3: Bene Esau ni Elifazi na Ruweli na Yushi na Yalamu na Kora.
column4: Fils d’Esaü : Eliphaz, Reouel, Yeoush, Yaelam et Qorah.

column2: The sons of Eliphaz: Teman, Omar, Zepho, Gatam and Kenaz; by Timna: Amalek.
column3: Bene Elifazi ni Temani na Omari na Sefi na Gatamu na Kenazi na Timuna na Amaleki.
column4: Fils d’Eliphaz : Témân, Omar, Tsepho , Gaetam, Qenaz, Timna et Amalec.

column2: The sons of Reuel: Nahath, Zerah, Shammah and Mizzah.
column3: Bene Ruweli ni Nahati na Zera na Shama na Miza.
column4: Fils de Reouel : Nahath, Zérah, Shamma et Mizza.

column2: The sons of Seir: Lotan, Shobal, Zibeon, Anah, Dishon, Ezer and Dishan.
column3: Bene Seyiri ni Lotani na Shobali na Sibeyoni na Ana na Dishoni na Etseri na Dishani.
column4: Descendants de Séir : Lotân, Shobal, Tsibeôn, Ana, Dishôn, Etser et Dishân.

column2: The sons of Lotan: Hori and Homam. Timna was Lotan’s sister.
column3: Bene Lotani ni Hori na Homamu; kandi mushiki wa Lotani yari Timuna.
column4: Descendants de Lotân : Hori et Homam. La sœur de Lotân s’appelait Timna.

column2: The sons of Shobal: Alvan, Manahath, Ebal, Shepho and Onam. The sons of Zibeon: Aiah and Anah.
column3: Bene Shobali ni Aliyani na Manahati na Ebali na Shefi na Onamu. Bene Sibeyoni ni Aya na Ana.
column4: Descendants de Shobal : Alvân , Manahath, Ebal, Shepho et Onam. Fils de Tsibeôn : Aya et Ana.

column2: The son of Anah: Dishon. The sons of Dishon: Hemdan, Eshban, Ithran and Keran.
column3: Bene Ana ni Dishoni. Bene Dishoni ni Hamurani na Eshibani na Yitirani na Kerani.
column4: Enfants d’Ana : Dishôn. Fils de Dishôn : Hemdân , Eshbân, Yitrân et Kerân.

column2: The sons of Ezer: Bilhan, Zaavan and Akan. The sons of Dishan : Uz and Aran.
column3: Bene Etseri ni Biluhani na Zayavani na Yakani. Bene Dishani ni Uzi na Arani.
column4: Fils d’Etser : Bilhân, Zaavân et Aqân . Fils de Dishân : Outs et Arân.

column2: These were the kings who reigned in Edom before any Israelite king reigned: Bela son of Beor, whose city was named Dinhabah.
column3: Aba ni bo bami babaye ku ngoma mu gihugu ca Edomu, hatarīma umwami mu Bisirayeli. Bela mwene Beyori; umurwa wiwe witwa Dinihaba.
column4: Voici les rois qui ont régné dans le pays d’Edom, avant qu’il y ait un roi en Israël : Béla, fils de Béor ; sa ville s’appelait Dinhaba.

column2: When Bela died, Jobab son of Zerah from Bozrah succeeded him as king.
column3: Bela atanze, Yobabu mwene Zera w’i Bosira asubira ku ngoma yiwe.
column4: Après sa mort, Yobab, fils de Zérah, de Botsra, régna à sa place.

column2: When Jobab died, Husham from the land of the Temanites succeeded him as king.
column3: Yobabu atanze, Hushamu wo mu gihugu c’Abatemani asubira ku ngoma yiwe.
column4: Yobab mourut et Housham, du pays des Témanites, régna à sa place.

column2: When Husham died, Hadad son of Bedad, who defeated Midian in the country of Moab, succeeded him as king. His city was named Avith.
column3: Hushamu atanze, Hadadi mwene Bedadi, umwe yaneshereza Abamidiyani mu gihugu c’i Mowabu, asubira ku ngoma yiwe; umurwa wiwe witwa Aviti.
column4: Après la mort de Housham, Hadad, fils de Bedad, régna à sa place. Il battit les Madianites dans la campagne de Moab ; il venait de la ville d’Avith.

column2: When Hadad died, Samlah from Masrekah succeeded him as king.
column3: Hadadi atanze, Samula w’i Masireka asubira ku ngoma yiwe.
column4: Après la mort de Hadad, Samla, de Masréqa, régna à sa place.

column2: When Samlah died, Shaul from Rehoboth on the river succeeded him as king.
column3: Samula atanze, Sauli w’i Rehoboti ahahera kuri rwa Ruzi, asubira ku ngoma yiwe.
column4: Puis après la mort de Samla, Saül, de Rehoboth sur le fleuve, régna à sa place.

column2: When Shaul died, Baal-Hanan son of Akbor succeeded him as king.
column3: Sauli atanze, Bayali‐hanani mwene Akibori asubira ku ngoma yiwe.
column4: Après la mort de Saül, Baal-Hanân, fils d’Akbor, régna à sa place.

column2: When Baal-Hanan died, Hadad succeeded him as king. His city was named Pau, and his wife’s name was Mehetabel daughter of Matred, the daughter of Me-Zahab.
column3: Bayali‐hanani atanze, Hadadi asubira ku ngoma yiwe; umurwa wiwe witwa Payi; umwamikazi wiwe yitwa Mehetabeli, umukobga wa Matiredi, Matiredi umukobga wa Mezahabu.
column4: Après la mort de Baal-Hanân, Hadad régna à sa place. Sa ville s’appelait Paou , le nom de sa femme était Mehétabéel, fille de Matred, et petite-fille de Mézahab.

column2: Hadad also died. The chiefs of Edom were: Timna, Alvah, Jetheth,
column3: Hadadi na we aratanga. Abakuru b’imiryango yakomōtse kuri Edomu ni Timuna na Aliya na Yeteti,
column4: Après la mort de Hadad, des chefs de familles gouvernèrent Edom. Ce furent les chefs Timna, Alva, Yeteth,

column2: Oholibamah, Elah, Pinon,
column3: na Oholibama na Ela na Pinoni,
column4: Oholibama, Ela, Pinôn,

column2: Kenaz, Teman, Mibzar,
column3: na Kenazi na Temani na Mibusari,
column4: Qenaz, Témân, Mibtsar,

column2: Magdiel and Iram. These were the chiefs of Edom.
column3: na Magidiyeli na Iramu. Abo ni bo bakuru b’imiryango yakomōtse kuri Edomu.
column4: Magdiel et Iram. Tels sont les chefs d’Edom.

column2: These were the sons of Israel: Reuben, Simeon, Levi, Judah, Issachar, Zebulun,
column3: Aba ni bo bana ba Isirayeli: Reyubeni na Simeyoni na Lewi na Yuda na Isakari na Zebuloni,
column4: Voici la liste des fils d’Israël . Ruben, Siméon, Lévi, Juda, Issacar, Zabulon,

column2: Dan, Joseph, Benjamin, Naphtali, Gad and Asher.
column3: na Dani na Yosefu na Benyamini na Nafutali na Gadi na Asheri.
column4: Dan, Joseph, Benjamin, Nephtali, Gad et Aser.

column2: The sons of Judah: Er, Onan and Shelah. These three were born to him by a Canaanite woman, the daughter of Shua. Er, Judah’s firstborn, was wicked in the Lord ’s sight; so the Lord put him to death.
column3: Bene Yuda ni Eri na Onani na Shela; abo ukw ari batatu yabavyaranye na Batishuwa Umunyakananikazi. Kandi Eri, imfura ya Yuda, yakora ivyo Uhoraho abona kw ari bibi: Uhoraho araheza aramwica.
column4: Juda eut trois fils, de sa femme cananéenne, la fille de Shoua : Er, Onân, Shéla. Er, le fils aîné de Juda, était jugé mauvais par l’Eternel qui le fit mourir.

column2: Judah’s daughter-in-law Tamar bore Perez and Zerah to Judah. He had five sons in all.
column3: Maze Yuda avyara Peresi na Zera kuri Tamari, umukazana wiwe. Nukw abahungu ba Yuda bose na bose bāri batanu.
column4: Tamar, la belle-fille de Juda, lui donna Pérets et Zérah . Juda eut donc en tout cinq fils.

column2: The sons of Perez: Hezron and Hamul.
column3: Bene Peresi ni Hesironi na Hamuli.
column4: Fils de Pérets : Hetsrôn et Hamoul.

column2: The sons of Zerah: Zimri, Ethan, Heman, Kalkol and Darda —five in all.
column3: Bene Zera ni Zimuri na Etani na Hemani na Kalukoli na Dara; bose na bose bāri batanu.
column4: Fils de Zérah : Zimri, Etân, Hémân, Kalkol et Darda , cinq en tout.

column2: The son of Karmi: Achar, who brought trouble on Israel by violating the ban on taking devoted things.
column3: Mwene Karumi ni Akani, yateje Abisirayeli amagorwa, igihe yacumura mu vyagizwe inyegu.
column4: Fils de Karmi : Akar (Trouble), qui fut cause de désordre en Israël lorsqu’il commit une infidélité à l’égard de ce qui était voué à l’Eternel.

column2: The son of Ethan: Azariah.
column3: Mwene Etani ni Azariya.
column4: Fils d’Etân : Azaria.

column2: The sons born to Hezron were: Jerahmeel, Ram and Caleb.
column3: Kand’ abana Hesironi yavyaye ni Yerameyeli na Ramu na Kelubayi.
column4: Fils de Hetsrôn : Yerahméel, Ram et Keloubaï .

column2: Ram was the father of Amminadab, and Amminadab the father of Nahshon, the leader of the people of Judah.
column3: Ramu avyara Aminadabu; Aminadabu avyara Nahashoni, umukuru wo mu muryango wa Yuda.
column4: Ram eut pour fils Amminadab, qui eut pour fils Nahshôn, chef des descendants de Juda.

column2: Nahshon was the father of Salmon, Salmon the father of Boaz,
column3: Nahashoni avyara Saluma; Saluma avyara Bowazi.
column4: Nahshôn eut pour fils Salma, qui eut pour fils Booz,

column2: Boaz the father of Obed and Obed the father of Jesse.
column3: Bowazi avyara Obedi; Obedi avyara Isayi.
column4: qui eut pour fils Obed, qui eut pour fils Isaï.

column2: Jesse was the father of Eliab his firstborn; the second son was Abinadab, the third Shimea,
column3: Isayi avyara Eliyabu, imfura yiwe, uwa kabiri ni Abinadabu, uwa gatatu ni Shimeya,
column4: Isaï eut pour fils : Eliab, son aîné, Abinadab, son deuxième, Shimea, son troisième.

column2: the fourth Nethanel, the fifth Raddai,
column3: uwa kane ni Netaneli, uwa gatanu ni Radayi,
column4: Netanéel, son quatrième, Raddaï, son cinquième,

column2: the sixth Ozem and the seventh David.
column3: uwa gatandatu ni Osemu, uw’ indwi ni Dawidi;
column4: Otsem son sixième, et David son septième.

column2: Their sisters were Zeruiah and Abigail. Zeruiah’s three sons were Abishai, Joab and Asahel.
column3: kandi bashiki babo ni Seruwiya na Abigayili. Abana ba Seruwiya ni Abishayi na Yowabu na Asaheli, ukw ari batatu.
column4: Leurs sœurs étaient Tserouya et Abigaïl. Tserouya eut trois fils : Abshaï, Joab et Asaël.

column2: Abigail was the mother of Amasa, whose father was Jether the Ishmaelite.
column3: Abigayili avyara Amasa, kandi se wa Amasa yari Yeteri w’Umwishimayeli.
column4: Abigaïl eut un fils, Amasa, de Yéter, l’Ismaélite.

column2: Caleb son of Hezron had children by his wife Azubah (and by Jerioth). These were her sons: Jesher, Shobab and Ardon.
column3: Kalebu mwene Hesironi avyara abana kuri Azuba umugore wiwe, no kuri Yeriyoti; aba ni bo bana ba Azuba: Yesheri na Shobabu na Aridoni.
column4: Caleb, fils de Hetsrôn, eut de sa femme Azouba une fille, Yerioth, et trois fils, Yésher, Shobab et Ardôn.

column2: When Azubah died, Caleb married Ephrath, who bore him Hur.
column3: Azuba apfuye, Kalebu yābīra Efurata, bavyarana Huri.
column4: Azouba mourut, et Caleb prit pour femme Ephrath, qui lui donna Hour.

column2: Hur was the father of Uri, and Uri the father of Bezalel.
column3: Huri avyara Uri, Uri avyara Besaleli.
column4: Hour eut pour fils Ouri, et Ouri Betsaléel.

column2: Later, Hezron, when he was sixty years old, married the daughter of Makir the father of Gilead. He made love to her, and she bore him Segub.
column3: Hanyuma Hesironi yābīra umukobga wa Makiri se wa Gileyadi, kandi Hesironi yar’ amaze imyaka mirongwitandatu igihe yamurongora; bavyarana Segubu.
column4: Ensuite, alors qu’il avait soixante ans, Hetsrôn s’unit à la fille de Makir, le père de Galaad, et l’épousa. Elle lui donna Segoub.

column2: Segub was the father of Jair, who controlled twenty-three towns in Gilead.
column3: Segubu avyara Yayiri; Yayiri ni we yaganza ibisagara mirongwibiri na bitatu mu ntāra y’i Gileyadi.
column4: Segoub eut pour fils Yaïr, qui posséda vingt-trois villes dans le pays de Galaad .

column2: (But Geshur and Aram captured Havvoth Jair, as well as Kenath with its surrounding settlements—sixty towns.) All these were descendants of Makir the father of Gilead.
column3: Hanyuma Geshuri na Aramu banyaga aba Yayiri ivyo bisagara, bo n’i Kenati n’udusagara tuhakūkira, vyose na vyose vyar’ ibisagara mirongwitandatu. Abo bose ni bo bandurutse kuri Makiri se wa Gileyadi.
column4: Mais les Gueshouriens et les Syriens prirent de ses descendants les bourgs de Yaïr ainsi que la ville de Qenath et les villes qui en dépendaient, ce qui faisait en tout soixante villes. Tous ceux qui y habitaient étaient des descendants de Makir, le père de Galaad.

column2: After Hezron died in Caleb Ephrathah, Abijah the wife of Hezron bore him Ashhur the father of Tekoa.
column3: Bukeye Hesironi amaze gupfa, aguye i Kalebu‐efurata, umugore wiwe Abiya inda yasigaranye ayivyaramwo Ashuri se wa Tekowa.
column4: Après la mort de Hetsrôn à Caleb-Ephrata, Abiya, sa femme, donna encore naissance à un fils de lui : Ashhour, le père de Teqoa.

column2: The sons of Jerahmeel the firstborn of Hezron: Ram his firstborn, Bunah, Oren, Ozem and Ahijah.
column3: Bene Yerameyeli imfura ya Hesironi n’aba: uw’ imfura ni Ramu, agakurikirwa na Buna na Oreni na Osemu na Ahiya.
column4: Les fils de Yerahméel, premier-né de Hetsrôn, furent : Ram, l’aîné, Bouna, Orên, Otsem et Ahiya.

column2: Jerahmeel had another wife, whose name was Atarah; she was the mother of Onam.
column3: Kandi Yerameyeli yar’ afise uwundi mugore yitwa Atara; uwo ni we nyina wa Onamu.
column4: Yerahméel eut une autre femme, Atara, qui lui donna Onam.

column2: The sons of Ram the firstborn of Jerahmeel: Maaz, Jamin and Eker.
column3: Bene Ramu imfura ya Yerameyeli ni Mayasi na Yamini na Ekeri.
column4: Les fils de Ram, le premier-né de Yerahméel, furent : Maats, Yamîn et Eqer.

column2: The sons of Onam: Shammai and Jada. The sons of Shammai: Nadab and Abishur.
column3: Bene Onamu ni Shamayi na Yada; bene Shamayi ni Nadabu na Abishuri.
column4: Les fils d’Onam furent : Shammaï et Yada. Fils de Shammaï : Nadab et Abishour.

column2: Abishur’s wife was named Abihail, who bore him Ahban and Molid.
column3: Muka Abishuri yitwa Abihayili: bavyarana Ahubani na Molidi.
column4: La femme d’Abishour s’appelait Abihaïl, elle lui donna Ahbân et Molid.

column2: The sons of Nadab: Seled and Appaim. Seled died without children.
column3: Bene Nadabu ni Seledi na Apayimu; ariko Seledi apfa ar’ imponnyi.
column4: Fils de Nadab : Séled et Appaïm. Séled mourut sans enfant.

column2: The son of Appaim: Ishi, who was the father of Sheshan. Sheshan was the father of Ahlai.
column3: Mwene Apayimu ni Ishi; mwene Ishi ni Sheshani; mwene Sheshani ni Ahulayi.
column4: Fils d’Appaïm : Yisheï qui fut le père de Shéshân. Shéshân fut le père de Ahlaï.

column2: The sons of Jada, Shammai’s brother: Jether and Jonathan. Jether died without children.
column3: Bene Yada murumuna wa Shamayi ni Yeteri na Yonatani; ariko Yeteri apfa ar’ imponnyi.
column4: Fils de Yada, frère de Shammaï : Yéter et Jonathan. Yéter mourut sans enfant.

column2: The sons of Jonathan: Peleth and Zaza. These were the descendants of Jerahmeel.
column3: Bene Yonatani ni Peleti na Zaza. Abo bose ni bo bandurutse kuri Yerameyeli.
column4: Fils de Jonathan : Péleth et Zaza. Ce sont là les descendants de Yerahméel.

column2: Sheshan had no sons—only daughters. He had an Egyptian servant named Jarha.
column3: Kandi Sheshani nta muhungu yagira, atar’ abakobga gusa; ariko yar’ afise umugurano ava muri Egiputa yitwa Yaruha;
column4: Shéshân n’avait pas de fils, il n’avait que des filles. Il avait un esclave égyptien nommé Yarha

column2: Sheshan gave his daughter in marriage to his servant Jarha, and she bore him Attai.
column3: nuko Sheshani uwo mugurano wiwe amushingira umukobga wiwe, bavyarana Atayi.
column4: à qui il donna l’une de ses filles pour femme ; celle-ci lui donna Attaï.

column2: Attai was the father of Nathan, Nathan the father of Zabad,
column3: Atayi avyara Natani, Natani avyara Zabadi;
column4: Attaï fut le père de Nathan, Nathan celui de Zabad,

column2: Zabad the father of Ephlal, Ephlal the father of Obed,
column3: Zabadi avyara Efulali, Efulali avyara Obedi;
column4: Zabad d’Ephlal, Ephlal d’Obed,

column2: Obed the father of Jehu, Jehu the father of Azariah,
column3: Obedi avyara Yehu, Yehu avyara Azariya;
column4: Obed de Jéhu, Jéhu d’Azaria,

column2: Azariah the father of Helez, Helez the father of Eleasah,
column3: Azariya avyara Helesi, Helesi avyara Eleyasa;
column4: Azaria de Hélets, Hélets d’Elasa,

column2: Eleasah the father of Sismai, Sismai the father of Shallum,
column3: Eleyasa avyara Sisimayi, Sisimayi avyara Shalumu;
column4: Elasa de Sismaï, Sismaï de Shalloum,

column2: Shallum the father of Jekamiah, and Jekamiah the father of Elishama.
column3: Shalumu avyara Yekamiya, Yekamiya avyara Elishama.
column4: Shalloum de Yeqamia, Yeqamia d’Elishama.

column2: The sons of Caleb the brother of Jerahmeel: Mesha his firstborn, who was the father of Ziph, and his son Mareshah, who was the father of Hebron.
column3: Mwene Kalebu murumuna wa Yerameyeli ni Maresha, kandi ni we mfura yiwe, ni we se wa Zifu; mwene Maresha ni Heburoni.
column4: Fils de Caleb, le frère de Yerahméel : Mésha , son premier-né, qui fut le père de Ziph, et Marésha , le père d’Hébron.

column2: The sons of Hebron: Korah, Tappuah, Rekem and Shema.
column3: Bene Heburoni ni Kora na Tapuwa na Rekemu na Shema.
column4: Fils d’Hébron : Qorah, Tappouah, Réqem et Shéma.

column2: Shema was the father of Raham, and Raham the father of Jorkeam. Rekem was the father of Shammai.
column3: Shema avyara Rahamu se wa Yorikeyamu; Rekemu na we avyara Shamayi.
column4: Shéma fut le père de Raham, et Raham le père de Yorqeam. Réqem fut le père de Shammaï.

column2: The son of Shammai was Maon, and Maon was the father of Beth Zur.
column3: Mwene Shamayi ni Mayoni; kandi Mayoni ni we se wa Beti‐suri.
column4: Shammaï eut pour fils Maôn, le père de Beth-Tsour.

column2: Caleb’s concubine Ephah was the mother of Haran, Moza and Gazez. Haran was the father of Gazez.
column3: Kandi Efa, incoreke ya Kalebu, Kalebu amuvyarako Hara na Mosa na Gazezi; Harani avyara Gazezi.
column4: Epha, épouse de second rang de Caleb, lui donna Harân, Motsa et Gazez. Harân fut le père de Gazez.

column2: The sons of Jahdai: Regem, Jotham, Geshan, Pelet, Ephah and Shaaph.
column3: Bene Yahidayi ni Regemu na Yotamu na Geshani na Peleti na Efa na Shafi.
column4: Fils de Yahdaï : Réguém, Yotam, Guéshân, Péleth, Epha et Shaaph.

column2: Caleb’s concubine Maakah was the mother of Sheber and Tirhanah.
column3: Kandi Mayaka, incoreke ya Kalebu, Kalebu amuvyarako Sheberi na Tiruhana.
column4: Maaka, une autre épouse de second rang de Caleb, lui donna Shéber et Tirhana.

column2: She also gave birth to Shaaph the father of Madmannah and to Sheva the father of Makbenah and Gibea. Caleb’s daughter was Aksah.
column3: Kandi bavyarana na Shafi se wa Madumana, na Sheva se wa Makubena, bo na se wa Gibeya; kand’ umukobga wa Kalebu yitwa Akisa.
column4: Plus tard, elle donna encore naissance à Shaaph, le père de Madmanna, et à Sheva, le père de Makbéna et de Guibéa. De plus, Caleb avait une fille nommée Aksa.

column2: These were the descendants of Caleb. The sons of Hur the firstborn of Ephrathah: Shobal the father of Kiriath Jearim,
column3: Abo bose ni bo bandurutse kuri Kalebu. Bene Huri imfura ya Efurata ni Shobali se wa Kiriyati‐yeyarimu,
column4: Tels furent les descendants de Caleb. Fils de Hour : le premier-né de son épouse Ephrata, Shobal, père de Qiryath-Yearim,

column2: Salma the father of Bethlehem, and Hareph the father of Beth Gader.
column3: na Saluma se wa Betelehemu, na Harefu se wa Beti‐gaderi.
column4: Salma, père de Bethléhem et Hareph, celui de Beth-Gader.

column2: The descendants of Shobal the father of Kiriath Jearim were: Haroeh, half the Manahathites,
column3: Kandi Shobali se wa Kiriyati‐yeyarimu yar’ afise abandi bahungu, ni Harowe na Hasi‐hamenuhoti.
column4: Shobal, le père de Qiryath-Yearim eut des fils : Haroé et Hatsi-Hammenouhoth.

column2: and the clans of Kiriath Jearim: the Ithrites, Puthites, Shumathites and Mishraites. From these descended the Zorathites and Eshtaolites.
column3: Imiryango yandurutse kuri Kiriyati‐yeyarimu n’Abanyituri n’Abaputi n’Abashumati n’Abamishurayi; kur’ abo ni ho handurutse Abasorati n’Abanyeshitayoli.
column4: Les familles de Qiryath-Yearim furent : les Yétériens, les Poutiens, les Shoumatiens et les Mishraïens ; de celles-là sont sortis les Tsoreatiens et les Eshtaoliens.

column2: The descendants of Salma: Bethlehem, the Netophathites, Atroth Beth Joab, half the Manahathites, the Zorites,
column3: Abandurutse kuri Saluma ni Betelehemu n’Abanetofati na Atiroti‐Beti‐Yowabu na Hasi‐hamanahati n’Abasori.
column4: Descendants de Salma : les habitants de Bethléhem, de Netopha, d’Atroth-Beth-Joab, d’Hatsi-Hammanahti et de Tsoreïa

column2: and the clans of scribes who lived at Jabez: the Tirathites, Shimeathites and Sucathites. These are the Kenites who came from Hammath, the father of the Rekabites.
column3: Imiryango y’abakarani yaba i Yabeshi, n’Abatirati n’Abashimeyati n’Abasukati. Abo ni bo Banyakeni bākomōtse kuri Hamati, ari we gishitsi c’umuryango wa Rekabu.
column4: ainsi que les familles des gens instruits habitant à Yaebets, les Tireatiens, les Shimeatiens et les Soukkatiens. Ce sont les Qéniens, issus de Hamath, ancêtre du groupe familial de Rékab .

column2: These were the sons of David born to him in Hebron: The firstborn was Amnon the son of Ahinoam of Jezreel; the second, Daniel the son of Abigail of Carmel;
column3: Aba ni bo bana b’abahungu Dawidi yavyariye i Heburoni: uw’ imfura ni Amunoni, uwo yavyaye kuri Ahinowamu w’i Yezireli; uwa kabiri ni Daniyeli, uwo yavyaye kuri Abigayili w’i Karumeli;
column4: Voici la liste des fils de David qui lui naquirent à Hébron. Le premier-né s’appelait Amnôn, il était fils d’Ahinoam de Jizréel ; le deuxième, Daniel, était fils d’Abigaïl de Karmel ;

column2: the third, Absalom the son of Maakah daughter of Talmai king of Geshur; the fourth, Adonijah the son of Haggith;
column3: uwa gatatu ni Abusalomu, uwo yavyaye kuri Mayaka, umukobga wa Talumayi umwami w’i Geshuri; uwa kane ni Adoniya, uwo yavyaye kuri Hagita;
column4: le troisième, Absalom, était le fils de Maaka, fille de Talmaï, le roi de Gueshour ; le quatrième, Adoniya, était le fils de Haggith ;

column2: the fifth, Shephatiah the son of Abital; and the sixth, Ithream, by his wife Eglah.
column3: uwa gatanu ni Shefatiya, uwo yavyaye kuri Abitali; uwa gatandatu ni Itureyamu, uwo yavyaye ku wundi mugore wiwe yitwa Egila.
column4: le cinquième, Shephatia, d’Abital ; le sixième, Yitream, de sa femme Egla.

column2: These six were born to David in Hebron, where he reigned seven years and six months. David reigned in Jerusalem thirty-three years,
column3: Abo ukw ari batandatu ni bo yavyariye i Heburoni; kandi yamaze ku ngoma imyaka ndwi n’amezi atandatu ar’ i Heburoni, n’iyindi mirongwitatu n’itatu ar’ i Yerusalemu.
column4: Ces six fils lui naquirent à Hébron, où il régna sept ans et six mois. Il régna ensuite trente-trois ans à Jérusalem .

column2: and these were the children born to him there: Shammua, Shobab, Nathan and Solomon. These four were by Bathsheba daughter of Ammiel.
column3: Aba ni bo yavyariye i Yerusalemu: Shimeya na Shobabu na Natani na Salomo, abo ukw ari bane yabavyaye kuri Batishuwa umukobga wa Amiyeli;
column4: Voici les enfants qui lui naquirent à Jérusalem : Shimea, Shobab, Nathan, Salomon, tous les quatre de Bath-Shoua , fille d’Ammiel.

column2: There were also Ibhar, Elishua, Eliphelet,
column3: avyara na Ibuhari na Elishama na Elifeleti,
column4: Il eut encore : Yibhar, Elishama , Eliphéleth,

column2: Nogah, Nepheg, Japhia,
column3: na Noga na Nefegi na Yafiya,
column4: Noga, Népheg, Yaphia,

column2: Elishama, Eliada and Eliphelet—nine in all.
column3: na Elishama na Eliyada na Elifeleti ukw ar icenda.
column4: Elishama, Elyada et Eliphéleth, soit neuf autres fils de David.

column2: All these were the sons of David, besides his sons by his concubines. And Tamar was their sister.
column3: Abo bose bar’ abahungu ba Dawidi, udashizemw’ abo yavyaye ku ncoreke ziwe; kandi bari bafise mushiki wabo Tamari.
column4: Ses épouses de second rang lui donnèrent aussi des fils. Tamar était leur sœur.

column2: Solomon’s son was Rehoboam, Abijah his son, Asa his son, Jehoshaphat his son,
column3: Umuhungu wa Salomo ni Rehobowamu, uwa Rehobowamu ni Abiya, uwa Abiya ni Asa, uwa Asa ni Yehoshafati;
column4: Les descendants de Salomon , en ligne directe de père en fils, furent : Roboam, Abiya, Asa, Josaphat,

column2: Jehoram his son, Ahaziah his son, Joash his son,
column3: uwa Yehoshafati ni Yoramu, uwa Yoramu ni Ahaziya, uwa Ahaziya ni Yowasi;
column4: Yoram, Ahazia, Joas,

column2: Amaziah his son, Azariah his son, Jotham his son,
column3: uwa Yowasi ni Amaziya, uwa Amaziya ni Uziya, uwa Uziya ni Yotamu;
column4: Amatsia, Azaria, Yotam,

column2: Ahaz his son, Hezekiah his son, Manasseh his son,
column3: uwa Yotamu ni Ahazi, uwa Ahazi ni Hezekiya, uwa Hezekiya ni Manase;
column4: Ahaz, Ezéchias, Manassé,

column2: Amon his son, Josiah his son.
column3: uwa Manase ni Amoni, uwa Amoni ni Yosiya.
column4: Amôn, Josias.

column2: The sons of Josiah: Johanan the firstborn, Jehoiakim the second son, Zedekiah the third, Shallum the fourth.
column3: Bene Yosiya, uw’imfura ni Yohanani, uwa kabiri ni Yehoyakimu, uwa gatatu ni Zedekiya, uwa kane ni Shalumu.
column4: Fils de Josias : le premier-né, Yohanân ; le second, Yehoyaqim ; le troisième, Sédécias ; le quatrième, Shalloum.

column2: The successors of Jehoiakim: Jehoiachin his son, and Zedekiah.
column3: Umuhungu wa Yehoyakimu ni Yekoniya, uwa Yekoniya ni Zedekiya.
column4: Fils de Yehoyaqim : Yekonia et Sédécias.

column2: The descendants of Jehoiachin the captive: Shealtiel his son,
column3: Abo Yekoniya yavyaye ar’ imbohe ni Sheyalutiyeli,
column4: Descendants de Yekonia, qui fut emmené en captivité : Shealtiel, son fils,

column2: Malkiram, Pedaiah, Shenazzar, Jekamiah, Hoshama and Nedabiah.
column3: na Malikiramu na Pedaya na Shenasari na Yekamiya na Hoshama na Nedabiya.
column4: et Malkiram, Pedaya, Shénatsar, Yeqamia, Hoshama et Nedabia.

column2: The sons of Pedaiah: Zerubbabel and Shimei. The sons of Zerubbabel: Meshullam and Hananiah. Shelomith was their sister.
column3: Bene Pedaya ni Zerubabeli na Shimeyi; bene Zerubabeli ni Meshulamu na Hananiya, kandi bari bafise mushiki wabo Shelomiti;
column4: Fils de Pedaya : Zorobabel et Shimeï. Zorobabel eut deux fils : Meshoullam et Hanania ; Shelomith était leur sœur.

column2: There were also five others: Hashubah, Ohel, Berekiah, Hasadiah and Jushab-Hesed.
column3: kandi yari yavyaye n’abandi batanu, Hashuba na Oheli na Berekiya na Hasadiya na Yushabu‐hesedi.
column4: Puis Hashouba, Ohel, Bérékia, Hasadia, Youshab-Hésed, soit cinq.

column2: The descendants of Hananiah: Pelatiah and Jeshaiah, and the sons of Rephaiah, of Arnan, of Obadiah and of Shekaniah.
column3: Mwene Hananiya ni Pelatiya, uwa Pelatiya ni Yeshaya, uwa Yeshaya ni Refaya, uwa Refaya ni Arunani, uwa Arunani ni Obadiya, uwa Obadiya ni Shekaniya;
column4: Descendants de Hanania : Pelatia et Esaïe ; les fils de Rephaya, ceux d’Arnân, d’Abdias et de Shekania.

column2: The descendants of Shekaniah: Shemaiah and his sons: Hattush, Igal, Bariah, Neariah and Shaphat—six in all.
column3: uwa Shekaniya ni Shemaya; bene Shemaya ni Hatushi na Igali na Bariya na Neyariya na Shafati, ukw ari batandatu;
column4: Shekania eut six fils : Shemaya , Hattoush, Yiguéal, Bariah, Nearia et Shaphath.

column2: The sons of Neariah: Elioenai, Hizkiah and Azrikam—three in all.
column3: bene Neyariya ni Eliyowenayi na Hizikiya na Azurikamu, ukw ari batatu.
column4: Nearia eut trois fils : Elyoénaï, Ezéchias et Azriqam.

column2: The sons of Elioenai: Hodaviah, Eliashib, Pelaiah, Akkub, Johanan, Delaiah and Anani—seven in all.
column3: Bene Eliyowenayi ni Hodaviya na Eliyashibu na Pelaya na Akubu na Yohanani na Delaya na Anani, ukw ar indwi.
column4: Elyoénaï eut sept fils : Hodavia, Eliashib, Pelaya, Aqqoub, Yohanân, Delaya et Anani.

column2: The descendants of Judah: Perez, Hezron, Karmi, Hur and Shobal.
column3: Abākomōtse kuri Yuda ni Peresi na Hesironi na Karumi na Huri na Shobali.
column4: Descendants de Juda : Pérets, Hetsrôn, Karmi , Hour et Shobal.

column2: Reaiah son of Shobal was the father of Jahath, and Jahath the father of Ahumai and Lahad. These were the clans of the Zorathites.
column3: Reyaya mwene Shobali yavyaye Yahati; Yahati avyara Ahumayi na Lahadi. Iyo ni yo miryango y’Abazorati.
column4: Reaya, fils de Shobal, fut le père de Yahath, et Yahath celui de Ahoumaï et Lahad. Ce sont les ancêtres des familles des Tsoreatiens.

column2: These were the sons of Etam: Jezreel, Ishma and Idbash. Their sister was named Hazzelelponi.
column3: Aba ni bo bene Etamu: Yezireli na Ishuma na Idubashi, kandi mushiki wabo yitwa Haseleliponi;
column4: Fils d’Etam : Jizréel, Yishma et Yidbash, et leur sœur Hatselelponi.

column2: Penuel was the father of Gedor, and Ezer the father of Hushah. These were the descendants of Hur, the firstborn of Ephrathah and father of Bethlehem.
column3: kandi Penuweli yari se wa Gedori, na Ezeri yari se wa Husha. Abo ni bo bākomōtse kuri Huri, imfura ya Efurata se wa Betelehemu.
column4: Penouel était le père de Guedor et Ezer celui de Housha. Ce sont là les fils de Hour, premier-né d’Ephrata, père de Bethléhem .

column2: Ashhur the father of Tekoa had two wives, Helah and Naarah.
column3: Ashuri se wa Tekowa yar’ afise abagore babiri, Hela na Nayara.
column4: Ashhour, père de Teqoa, eut deux femmes, Hélea et Naara.

column2: Naarah bore him Ahuzzam, Hepher, Temeni and Haahashtari. These were the descendants of Naarah.
column3: Kuri Nayara avyara Ahuzamu na Heferi na Temeni na Hahashutari. Abo ni bo yavyaranye na Nayara.
column4: Naara lui donna ces fils : Ahouzzam, Hépher, Témeni et Ahashtari.

column2: The sons of Helah: Zereth, Zohar, Ethnan,
column3: Kuri Hela avyara Zereti na Isuhari na Etunani.
column4: Hélea lui donna ces fils : Tséreth, Tsohar et Etnân.

column2: and Koz, who was the father of Anub and Hazzobebah and of the clans of Aharhel son of Harum.
column3: Hakosi avyara Anubu na Sobeba, kandi ni we yamutsweko n’imiryango ya ba Aharuheli mwene Harumu.
column4: Qots fut le père d’Anoub et de Hatsobéba, et les familles d’Aharehél, fils d’Haroum.

column2: Jabez was more honorable than his brothers. His mother had named him Jabez, saying, “I gave birth to him in pain.”
column3: Yabesi yarusha icubahiro bene nyina; kandi nyina yamwise Yabesi, kuko yavuze, ati Namushikanye bingoye.
column4: Yaebets était plus considéré que ses frères, sa mère lui avait donné le nom de Yaebets en disant : « C’est parce que je l’ai enfanté dans la douleur. »

column2: Jabez cried out to the God of Israel, “Oh, that you would bless me and enlarge my territory! Let your hand be with me, and keep me from harm so that I will be free from pain.” And God granted his request.
column3: Yabesi atakambira Imana y’Abisirayeli, at’ Icompa ukampa umugisha, ukūngura urubibe rwanje, ukuboko kwawe kukagenda kundamira, ukandinda ivyago, singorwe! Nukw Imana imuha ivyo yasavye.
column4: Yaebets invoqua le Dieu d’Israël en disant : « Si tu me bénis réellement et si tu agrandis mon territoire, si tu es avec moi, si tu éloignes de moi le malheur pour m’épargner la souffrance… » Et Dieu lui accorda ce qu’il avait demandé.

column2: Kelub, Shuhah’s brother, was the father of Mehir, who was the father of Eshton.
column3: Kelubu murumuna wa Shuha avyara Mehiri se wa Eshitoni.
column4: Keloub, frère de Shouha, eut pour fils Mehir, qui fut le père d’Eshtôn.

column2: Eshton was the father of Beth Rapha, Paseah and Tehinnah the father of Ir Nahash. These were the men of Rekah.
column3: Eshitoni avyara Beti‐rafa na Paseya na Tehina se wa Irunahashi. Abo ni bo bantu ba Reka.
column4: Eshtôn fut le père de Beth-Rapha, Paséah et Tehinna, le père de Ir-Nahash . Ce sont là les gens qui habitèrent Réka.

column2: The sons of Kenaz: Othniel and Seraiah. The sons of Othniel: Hathath and Meonothai.
column3: Bene Kenazi ni Otiniyeli na Seraya; bene Otiniyeli ni Hatati na Meyonotayi.
column4: Fils de Qenaz : Otniel et Seraya. Fils d’Otniel : Hatath

column2: Meonothai was the father of Ophrah. Seraiah was the father of Joab, the father of Ge Harashim. It was called this because its people were skilled workers.
column3: Meyonotayi avyara Ofura; Seraya avyara Yowabu se wa Geharashimu; kandi bār’ abafundi.
column4: et Meonotaï qui fut le père d’Ophra. Seraya fut le père de Joab qui fut celui de Ge-Harashim .

column2: The sons of Caleb son of Jephunneh: Iru, Elah and Naam. The son of Elah: Kenaz.
column3: Bene Kalebu mwene Yefune ni Iru na Ela na Nayamu; mwene Ela ni Kenazi.
column4: Fils de Caleb, fils de Yephounné : Irou, Ela et Naam. Qenaz fut le fils d’Ela.

column2: The sons of Jehallelel: Ziph, Ziphah, Tiria and Asarel.
column3: Bene Yehaleleli ni Zifu na Zifa na Tiriya na Asareli.
column4: Fils de Yehalléléel : Ziph, Zipha, Tirya et Asaréel.

column2: The sons of Ezrah: Jether, Mered, Epher and Jalon. One of Mered’s wives gave birth to Miriam, Shammai and Ishbah the father of Eshtemoa.
column3: Bene Ezera ni Yeteri na Meredi na Eferi na Yaloni; kand’ aba ni bo bana Bitiya umukobga wa Farawo yavyaranye na Meredi, ari we nyene yamurongoye: avyara Miriyamu na Shamayi na Ishuba na se wa Eshitemowa.

column2: (His wife from the tribe of Judah gave birth to Jered the father of Gedor, Heber the father of Soko, and Jekuthiel the father of Zanoah.) These were the children of Pharaoh’s daughter Bithiah, whom Mered had married.
column3: Umugore wiwe w’Umuyudakazi avyara Yeredi se wa Gedori, na Heberi se wa Soko, na Yekutiyeli se wa Zanowa.

column2: The sons of Hodiah’s wife, the sister of Naham: the father of Keilah the Garmite, and Eshtemoa the Maakathite.
column3: Abana ba muka Hodiya, mushiki wa Nahumu, ni se wa Keyila w’i Garumi na se wa Eshitemowa w’i Mayaka.
column4: Fils de la femme de Hodiya, sœur de Naham : le père de Qeïla, le Garmite et d’Eshtemoa, le Maakathien.

column2: The sons of Shimon: Amnon, Rinnah, Ben-Hanan and Tilon. The descendants of Ishi: Zoheth and Ben-Zoheth.
column3: Bene Shimoni ni Amunoni na Rina na Beni‐hanani na Tiloni. Bene Ishi ni Zoheti na Beni‐zoheti.
column4: Fils de Simon : Amnôn, Rinna, Ben-Hanan et Tilôn. Fils de Yisheï : Zoheth et Ben-Zoheth.

column2: The sons of Shelah son of Judah: Er the father of Lekah, Laadah the father of Mareshah and the clans of the linen workers at Beth Ashbea,
column3: Aba ni bo bana ba Shela mwene Yuda: Eri se wa Leka, na Layada se wa Maresha, kandi ni we yakomōtsweko n’imiryango y’abajishi b’impuzu zera derere, bo mu nzu ya Ashibeya,
column4: Descendants de Shéla, fils de Juda : Er, père de Léka, Laeda, père de Marésha, et les familles qui travaillent le byssus à Beth-Ashbéa,

column2: Jokim, the men of Kozeba, and Joash and Saraph, who ruled in Moab and Jashubi Lehem. (These records are from ancient times.)
column3: na Yokimu n’abantu b’i Kozeba, na Yowasi na Sarafu, ari bo bātwara i Mowabu, bo na Yashubilehemu; kand’ ayo majambo n’aya kera.
column4: Yoqim, les hommes de Kozéba, Joas et Saraph, qui dominèrent sur Moab, et sur Yashoubi-Léhem. Ces choses sont anciennes.

column2: They were the potters who lived at Netaim and Gederah; they stayed there and worked for the king.
column3: Abo ni bo bār’ ababumvyi, baba i Netayimu n’i Gedera; bāba ngaho ku mwami, bamukorera igikorwa.
column4: C’étaient des potiers qui habitaient à Netaïm et Guedéra, près du roi, et travaillaient pour lui.

column2: The descendants of Simeon: Nemuel, Jamin, Jarib, Zerah and Shaul;
column3: Bene Simeyoni ni Nemuweli na Yamini na Yaribu na Zera na Shauli.
column4: Fils de Siméon : Nemouel, Yamîn, Yarib, Zérah, Saül.

column2: Shallum was Shaul’s son, Mibsam his son and Mishma his son.
column3: Umuhungu wa Shauli ni Shalumu, uwa Shalumu ni Mibusamu, uwa Mibusamu ni Mishuma;
column4: Son fils : Shalloum, son fils Mibsam, son fils Mishma.

column2: The descendants of Mishma: Hammuel his son, Zakkur his son and Shimei his son.
column3: umuhungu wa Mishuma ni Hamuweli, uwa Hamuweli ni Zakuri, uwa Zakuri ni Shimeyi.
column4: Mishma eut pour fils Hammouel, Zakkour et Shimeï.

column2: Shimei had sixteen sons and six daughters, but his brothers did not have many children; so their entire clan did not become as numerous as the people of Judah.
column3: Shimeyi yavyaye abahungu cumi na batandatu n’ abakobga batandatu; arikw abo bāvukana ntibāvyaye abana benshi; kand’ umuryango wabo wose ntiwagwiriye nk’uw’ Abayuda.
column4: Shimeï eut seize fils et six filles. Ses frères n’eurent pas beaucoup de fils. C’est pourquoi les familles de Siméon ne se multiplièrent pas autant que les descendants de Juda.

column2: They lived in Beersheba, Moladah, Hazar Shual,
column3: Kandi bāba i Beri‐sheba n’i Molada n’i Hazari‐shuwali,
column4: Elles habitaient à Beer-Sheva, à Molada, à Hatsar-Shoual ,

column2: Bilhah, Ezem, Tolad,
column3: n’i Biluha n’i Esemu n’i Toladi,
column4: à Bilha, à Etsem, à Tolad,

column2: Bethuel, Hormah, Ziklag,
column3: n’i Betuweli n’i Horuma n’i Sikulagi,
column4: à Betouel, à Horma, à Tsiqlag,

column2: Beth Markaboth, Hazar Susim, Beth Biri and Shaaraim. These were their towns until the reign of David.
column3: n’i Beti‐marukaboti n’i Hazari‐susimu n’i Beti‐biri n’i Shayarayimu. Ivyo ni vyo vyar’ ibisagara vyabo gushitsa aho Dawidi yīmiye.
column4: à Beth-Markaboth, à Hatsar-Sousim, à Beth-Bireï et à Shaaraïm. Telles furent leurs villes jusqu’au règne de David,

column2: Their surrounding villages were Etam, Ain, Rimmon, Token and Ashan—five towns—
column3: Utundi dusagara twabo ni Etamu na Ayini na Rimoni na Tokeni na Ashani, twose na twose ni dutanu;
column4: et leurs villages étaient au nombre de cinq : Etam, Aïn, Rimmôn, Tokên et Ashân.

column2: and all the villages around these towns as far as Baalath. These were their settlements. And they kept a genealogical record.
column3: bo n’imihana yabo yose yo hirya no hino y’ivyo bisagara nyene, ukarinda ushitsa i Bayali. Aho ni ho bāba, kandi bari bafise igitabo kidōndōra ba sekuruza.
column4: Il faut ajouter tous les villages qui sont aux alentours de ces villes, jusqu’à Baal . Telles furent leurs habitations et leur généalogie.

column2: Meshobab, Jamlech, Joshah son of Amaziah,
column3: Aya mazina Meshobabu na Yamuleki na Yosha mwene Amaziya,
column4: Meshobab ; Yamlek ; Yosha, fils d’Amatsia ;

column2: Joel, Jehu son of Joshibiah, the son of Seraiah, the son of Asiel,
column3: na Yoweli na Yehu mwene Yoshibiya, Yoshibiya mwene Seraya, Seraya mwene Asiyeli,
column4: Joël, Jéhu, fils de Yoshibia, fils de Seraya, fils de Asiel,

column2: also Elioenai, Jaakobah, Jeshohaiah, Asaiah, Adiel, Jesimiel, Benaiah,
column3: na Eliyowenayi na Yakoba na Yeshohaya na Asaya na Adiyeli na Yesimiyeli na Benaya;
column4: Elyoénaï, Yaaqoba ; Yeshohaya, Asaya, Adiel, Yesimiel, Benaya,

column2: and Ziza son of Shiphi, the son of Allon, the son of Jedaiah, the son of Shimri, the son of Shemaiah.
column3: na Ziza mwene Shifi, Shifi mwene Aloni, Aloni mwene Yedaya, Yedaya mwene Shimuri, Shimuri mwene Semaya;
column4: Ziza, fils de Shipheï, et petit-fils d’Allôn, lui-même descendant de Yedaya, de Shimri et de Shemaya.

column2: The men listed above by name were leaders of their clans. Their families increased greatly,
column3: abo uko tubadōnze amazina ni bo bār’ abakuru mu miryango yabo; kand’ amazu ya ba sekuruza yagenda agwira cane.
column4: Ces hommes qui viennent d’être nommés étaient les chefs de leurs familles, leurs groupes familiaux devinrent très nombreux

column2: and they went to the outskirts of Gedor to the east of the valley in search of pasture for their flocks.
column3: Baja ahashikirwa i Gedori, bagendana uruhande rw’umwonga ruhera i burasirazuba, baronderera imikuku yabo amaragiro.
column4: et ils se dispersèrent jusqu’à l’entrée de Guedor, à l’est de la vallée, afin de chercher des pâturages pour leurs moutons et chèvres.

column2: They found rich, good pasture, and the land was spacious, peaceful and quiet. Some Hamites had lived there formerly.
column3: Basanga har’ ubgatsi bgiza butotahaye, kand’ igihugu cari cāgutse, gifise umutēkāno n’amahoro; kukw abābayo ubga mbere bandurutse kuri Hamu.
column4: Ils trouvèrent de gras et bons pâturages, et un pays vaste, tranquille et paisible ; ceux qui l’habitaient auparavant descendaient de Cham .

column2: The men whose names were listed came in the days of Hezekiah king of Judah. They attacked the Hamites in their dwellings and also the Meunites who were there and completely destroyed them, as is evident to this day. Then they settled in their place, because there was pasture for their flocks.
column3: Kandi ba bandi banditswe amazina yabo baje ku ngoma ya Hezekiya umwami w’i Buyuda, batera amahema yabo, batera n’Abameyunimu basanzeyo, barabazimiriza rwose gushitsa n’ubu, basubira mu matongo yabo, kuko hār’ amaragiro y’imikuku yabo.
column4: Du temps d’Ezéchias, roi de Juda, ces hommes qui viennent d’être cités arrivèrent dans cette région, détruisirent les lieux d’habitation et les abris qui se trouvaient là, ils exterminèrent les habitants pour les vouer à l’Eternel, et ceux-ci ont disparu jusqu’à ce jour. Puis ils s’établirent à leur place, car il y avait là des pâturages pour leur petit bétail.

column2: And five hundred of these Simeonites, led by Pelatiah, Neariah, Rephaiah and Uzziel, the sons of Ishi, invaded the hill country of Seir.
column3: Kandi mur’ abo ba Simeyoni, bamwe muri bo, abantu amajana atanu, baja gutera umusozi Seyiri, bari kumwe n’abagabisha babo Pelatiya na Neyariya na Refaya na Uziyeli, bene Ishi.
column4: Il y eut aussi cinq cents descendants de Siméon, qui se rendirent dans la région montagneuse de Séir, avec, à leur tête, Pelatia, Nearia, Rephaya et Ouzziel, les fils de Yisheï.

column2: They killed the remaining Amalekites who had escaped, and they have lived there to this day.
column3: Bageseza amasigarira y’Abamaleki bāri bārarokotse, baca babayo gushitsa na bugingo n’ubu.
column4: Ils tuèrent le reste des rescapés d’Amalec, et ont habité là jusqu’à aujourd’hui.

column2: The sons of Reuben the firstborn of Israel (he was the firstborn, but when he defiled his father’s marriage bed, his rights as firstborn were given to the sons of Joseph son of Israel; so he could not be listed in the genealogical record in accordance with his birthright,
column3: Aba ni bo bākomōtse kuri Reyubeni, imfura ya Isirayeli; ariko naho yar’ imfura, ubukuru bgiwe arabgākwa, kuko yūriye uburiri bga se, akabuhumanya, ubgo bukuru buhabga bene Yosefu, umwana wa Isirayeli nyene; yamara Yosefu ntiyatangurirwako nk’uw’ imfura, iyo bādōnda amazina yabo;
column4: Ruben était le premier-né d’Israël, mais parce qu’il avait eu des relations sexuelles avec l’une des femmes de son père, son droit d’aînesse fut donné aux fils de Joseph, fils d’Israël ; ainsi Ruben ne fut pas recensé comme l’aîné .

column2: and though Judah was the strongest of his brothers and a ruler came from him, the rights of the firstborn belonged to Joseph)—
column3: ubukuru bg’imfura bgar’ ubga Yosefu koko, ariko Yuda yar’ akomeye gusumba bene se, kandi kuri we ni ho handurutse segaba.
column4: Juda fut puissant parmi ses frères, et de lui est issu le prince d’Israël, mais le droit d’aînesse appartenait à Joseph .

column2: the sons of Reuben the firstborn of Israel: Hanok, Pallu, Hezron and Karmi.
column3: Nukw aba ni bo bana ba Reyubeni imfura ya Isirayeli: Hanoki na Palu na Hesironi na Karumi.
column4: Fils de Ruben, premier-né d’Israël : Hénok, Pallou, Hetsrôn et Karmi.

column2: The descendants of Joel: Shemaiah his son, Gog his son, Shimei his son,
column3: Aba ni bo bākomōtse kuri Yoweli: umuhungu wiwe ni Shemaya, uwa Shemaya ni Gogi, uwa Gogi ni Shimeyi,
column4: Descendants de Joël, de père en fils : Shemaya, Gog, Shimeï ;

column2: Micah his son, Reaiah his son, Baal his son,
column3: uwa Shimeyi ni Mika, uwa Mika ni Reyaya, uwa Reyaya ni Bayali,
column4: Michée, Reaya, Baal,

column2: and Beerah his son, whom Tiglath-Pileser king of Assyria took into exile. Beerah was a leader of the Reubenites.
column3: uwa Bayali ni Beyera; kandi Beyera, Tigulati‐pileseri umwami w’i Ashuri amujana ar’ inyagano; ni we yar’ umukuru wo mu ba Reyubeni.
column4: Beéra, un chef des Rubénites que Tiglath-Piléser , roi d’Assyrie, emmena en captivité .

column2: Their relatives by clans, listed according to their genealogical records: Jeiel the chief, Zechariah,
column3: Kandi bene wabo, ukw amazu yabo ari, uko bagiye baharūrwa nk’uk’ urunganwe rwabo rwagenda rukurikirana, umukuru wabo ni Yeyeli, agakurikirwa na Zekariya,
column4: Les hommes apparentés à Beéra, cités par familles selon leurs listes généalogiques sont : le chef Yeïel, Zacharie,

column2: and Bela son of Azaz, the son of Shema, the son of Joel. They settled in the area from Aroer to Nebo and Baal Meon.
column3: na Bela mwene Azazi, Azazi wa Shema, Shema wa Yoweli; abo aho bāba, bāhēra i Aroweri ukarinda ushitsa i Nebo n’i Bayali‐meyoni;
column4: Béla, fils d’Azaz, petit-fils de Shéma, le fils de Joël. Ces hommes habitaient à Aroër et dans le territoire qui va jusqu’au mont Nébo et Baal-Meôn.

column2: To the east they occupied the land up to the edge of the desert that extends to the Euphrates River, because their livestock had increased in Gilead.
column3: bāhēra n’ahahera i burasirazuba, ukarinda ushitsa ku bugaragwa bugarukira ku ruzi Efurate, kukw amasho yabo yagenda agwirirana mu gihugu c’i Gileyadi.
column4: A l’est, ils s’étaient implantés jusqu’à l’entrée du désert qui s’étend jusqu’à l’Euphrate, car leur cheptel était nombreux dans le pays de Galaad .

column2: During Saul’s reign they waged war against the Hagrites, who were defeated at their hands; they occupied the dwellings of the Hagrites throughout the entire region east of Gilead.
column3: Maze ku ngoma ya Sauli batera Abahaguri, barabageseza; baraheza binjira ingo zabo mur’ ico gihugu cose ahahera i burasirazuba bg’i Gileyadi.
column4: Du temps de Saül, ils firent la guerre aux Agaréniens , qui furent vaincus par eux ; ils s’installèrent dans leurs habitations dans la partie orientale de Galaad.

column2: The Gadites lived next to them in Bashan, as far as Salekah:
column3: Ab’ uruvyaro rwa Gadi bāri babangikanye na bo, aho bāba, bāhēra mu gihugu c’i Bashani, ukarinda ushitsa i Saleka;
column4: Les descendants de Gad habitaient sur le plateau du Basan et jusqu’à Salka.

column2: Joel was the chief, Shapham the second, then Janai and Shaphat, in Bashan.
column3: Yoweli ni we yari mukuru muri bo, uwa kabiri ni Shafamu na Yanayi na Shafati aho nyene i Bashani;
column4: Le groupe familial le plus important fut celui de Joël, puis, en deuxième, celui de Shapham, puis celui de Yaenaï et celui de Shaphath.

column2: Their relatives, by families, were: Michael, Meshullam, Sheba, Jorai, Jakan, Zia and Eber—seven in all.
column3: n’abandi b’i wabo bo mu mazu ya ba sekuruza, ni bo aba: Mikayeli na Meshulamu na Sheba na Yorayi na Yakani na Ziya na Eberi, ukw ar’ indwi;
column4: Il y avait à côté d’eux sept groupes familiaux : ceux de Michaël, Meshoullam, Shéba, Yoraï, Yaekan, Zia et Eber.

column2: These were the sons of Abihail son of Huri, the son of Jaroah, the son of Gilead, the son of Michael, the son of Jeshishai, the son of Jahdo, the son of Buz.
column3: abo bāri bene Abihayili, Abihayili wa Huri, Huri wa Yarowa, Yarowa wa Gileyadi, Gileyadi wa Mikayeli, Mikayeli wa Yeshishayi, Yeshishayi wa Yahudo, Yahudo wa Buzi.
column4: Ils étaient les fils d’Abihaïl, fils de Houri, dont les ascendants en ligne directe étaient Yaroah, Galaad, Michaël, Yeshishaï, Yahdo et Bouz.

column2: Ahi son of Abdiel, the son of Guni, was head of their family.
column3: Kandi Ahi mwene Abudiyeli, Abudiyeli wa Guni, ni we yari mukuru mu nzu ya ba sekuruza.
column4: Ahi, fils d’Abdiel et petit-fils de Gouni, était le chef de leurs groupes familiaux.

column2: The Gadites lived in Gilead, in Bashan and its outlying villages, and on all the pasturelands of Sharon as far as they extended.
column3: Abo bāba i Gileyadi, n’i Bashani, no mu bisagara vyaho, n’ahār’ amaragiro hose i Sharoni gushitsa ah’ agarukira.
column4: Ils habitaient en Galaad, en Basan et dans les localités qui en dépendent, ainsi que dans tous les pâturages du Sarôn jusqu’à leur extrême limite.

column2: All these were entered in the genealogical records during the reigns of Jotham king of Judah and Jeroboam king of Israel.
column3: Abo bose bāraharūwe, uk’ urunganwe rwabo rwagiye rukurikirana; bāharūwe ku ngoma ya Yotamu umwami w’i Buyuda no ku ngoma ya Yerobowamu umwami w’Abisirayeli.
column4: Ils furent tous recensés dans les généalogies, du temps de Yotam, roi de Juda, et du temps de Jéroboam, roi d’Israël .

column2: The Reubenites, the Gadites and the half-tribe of Manasseh had 44,760 men ready for military service—able-bodied men who could handle shield and sword, who could use a bow, and who were trained for battle.
column3: Mu Bareyubeni n’Abagadi n’igihimba c’umuryango w’Abamanase, hārimw’ abantu b’intōre, bar’ abahinga bo gutwara inkinzo n’inkota no kurasana, b’abahinga bazi kurwana; bose na bose bār’ ibihumbi mirongwine na bine n’amajana ndwi na mirongwitandatu, bazi kurwana.
column4: Les membres des tribus de Ruben, de Gad et de la demi-tribu de Manassé avaient 44 760 hommes valeureux capables de manier le bouclier et l’épée, ou tirant à l’arc. Ils étaient exercés à la guerre et prêts à combattre.

column2: They waged war against the Hagrites, Jetur, Naphish and Nodab.
column3: Bukeye batera Abahaguri na Yeturi na Nafisha na Nodabu;
column4: Ils firent la guerre aux Agaréniens et à Yetour, Naphish et Nodab.

column2: They were helped in fighting them, and God delivered the Hagrites and all their allies into their hands, because they cried out to him during the battle. He answered their prayers, because they trusted in him.
column3: maze batakambiye Imana mur’ iyo ntambara, irabumva kuko bayizigiye, irabatabara, igabura Abahaguri n’ abāri kumwe na bo bose mu maboko yabo;
column4: Dieu les secourut et leur donna la victoire sur les Agaréniens et tous leurs alliés, parce qu’ils l’en avaient imploré pendant la bataille. Il les exauça parce qu’ils lui avaient fait confiance.

column2: They seized the livestock of the Hagrites—fifty thousand camels, two hundred fifty thousand sheep and two thousand donkeys. They also took one hundred thousand people captive,
column3: banyaga amasho yabo, ingamiya ibihumbi mirongwitanu, n’intama ibihumbi amajana abiri na mirongwitanu, n’ indogoba ibihumbi bibiri; bafata mpiri abantu ibihumbi ijana.
column4: Ils s’emparèrent de tout leur bétail, à savoir : 50 000 chameaux, 250 000 moutons et chèvres et 2 000 ânes ; de plus, ils firent 100 000 prisonniers.

column2: and many others fell slain, because the battle was God’s. And they occupied the land until the exile.
column3: Benshi muri bo bāguye mur’ iyo ntambara, kuko yarimw’ Imana. Baraheza basubira mu matongo yabo, gushitsa igihe bambukanywe ar’ inyagano.
column4: Beaucoup d’ennemis furent aussi tués, car ce combat était entre les mains de Dieu. Ils s’installèrent à leur place et y demeurèrent jusqu’à l’exil.

column2: The people of the half-tribe of Manasseh were numerous; they settled in the land from Bashan to Baal Hermon, that is, to Senir (Mount Hermon).
column3: Ab’ igihimba c’umuryango wa Manase bāba mur’ ico gihugu, uhereye i Bashani ugashitsa i Bayali‐herumoni n’i Seniri no ku musozi Herumoni, kandi bāri benshi cane.
column4: Les descendants de la demi-tribu de Manassé habitaient dans le pays qui allait du Basan à Baal-Hermon, Senir et la montagne de l’Hermon ; ils étaient nombreux.

column2: These were the heads of their families: Epher, Ishi, Eliel, Azriel, Jeremiah, Hodaviah and Jahdiel. They were brave warriors, famous men, and heads of their families.
column3: Aba ni bo bār’ abakuru bo mu mazu ya ba sekuruza: Efeli na Ishi na Eliyeli na Azuriyeli na Yeremiya na Hodaviya na Yahudiyeli; bār’ abahizi ba rurangiranwa, kandi bār’ abakuru bo mu mazu ya ba sekuruza.
column4: Voici les noms des chefs de leurs groupes familiaux : Epher, Yisheï, Eliel, Azriel, Jérémie, Hodavia et Yahdiel ; ces chefs de leurs groupes familiaux étaient tous des hommes de guerre valeureux, des gens renommés.

column2: But they were unfaithful to the God of their ancestors and prostituted themselves to the gods of the peoples of the land, whom God had destroyed before them.
column3: Hanyuma bacumura ku Mana ya ba sekuruza, bagenda nk’ibimaka bahurumbira ibigirwamana vy’amahanga yo mur’ ico gihugu, ayo Imana yaranduye imbere yabo.
column4: Mais, par la suite, les descendants de ces tribus furent infidèles au Dieu de leurs ancêtres et se prostituèrent aux dieux des peuples du pays, que Dieu avait détruits devant eux.

column2: So the God of Israel stirred up the spirit of Pul king of Assyria (that is, Tiglath-Pileser king of Assyria), who took the Reubenites, the Gadites and the half-tribe of Manasseh into exile. He took them to Halah, Habor, Hara and the river of Gozan, where they are to this day.
column3: Hanyuma iyo Mana, ari yo nyene y’Abisirayeli, ibavyukiriza Puli, umwami w’i Ashuri, hanyuma ibavyukiriza Tigulati‐pileseri, umwami w’i Ashuri nyene, abambukana ar’ inyagano, abo Bareyubeni n’Abagadi n’ab’ igihimba c’umuryango wa Manase abajana i Halaha n’i Habori n’i Hara no ku ruzi Gozani, babayo na bugingo n’ubu.
column4: C’est pourquoi le Dieu d’Israël incita le roi d’Assyrie Poul, c’est-à-dire Tiglath-Piléser roi d’Assyrie, à déporter les membres des tribus de Ruben, de Gad et de la demi-tribu de Manassé : il les exila à Halah, Habor et Hara, et sur les rives du fleuve de Gozân, où ils sont demeurés jusqu’à ce jour .

column2: The sons of Levi: Gershon, Kohath and Merari.
column3: Bene Lewi ni Gerushoni na Kohati na Merari.
column4: Fils de Lévi : Guershôn, Qehath et Merari.

column2: The sons of Kohath: Amram, Izhar, Hebron and Uzziel.
column3: Bene Kohati ni Amuramu na Isihari na Heburoni na Uziyeli.
column4: Voici les noms des fils de Guershôn : Libni et Shimeï.

column2: The children of Amram: Aaron, Moses and Miriam. The sons of Aaron: Nadab, Abihu, Eleazar and Ithamar.
column3: Bene Amuramu ni Aroni na Mose na Miriyamu. Bene Aroni ni Nadabu na Abihu na Eleyazari na Itamari.
column4: Descendants de Qehath : Amram, Yitsehar, Hébron et Ouzziel.

column2: Eleazar was the father of Phinehas, Phinehas the father of Abishua,
column3: Eleyazari avyara Finehasi, Finehasi avyara Abishuwa;
column4: Fils de Merari : Mahli et Moushi.

column2: Abishua the father of Bukki, Bukki the father of Uzzi,
column3: Abishuwa avyara Buki, Buki avyara Uzi;
column4: Voici les familles de Lévi, données à partir de leur ancêtre. Pour Guershôn, de père en fils : Libni, Yahath, Zimma,

column2: Uzzi the father of Zerahiah, Zerahiah the father of Meraioth,
column3: Uzi avyara Zerahiya, Zerahiya avyara Merayoti;
column4: Yoah, Iddo, Zérah, Yeatraï.

column2: Meraioth the father of Amariah, Amariah the father of Ahitub,
column3: Merayoti avyara Amariya, Amariya avyara Ahitubu;
column4: Descendants de Qehath de père en fils : Amminadab, Qoré, Assir,

column2: Ahitub the father of Zadok, Zadok the father of Ahimaaz,
column3: Ahitubu avyara Sadoki, Sadoki avyara Ahimasi;
column4: Elqana, Ebyasaph, Assir,

column2: Ahimaaz the father of Azariah, Azariah the father of Johanan,
column3: Ahimasi avyara Azariya, Azariya avyara Yohanani;
column4: Tahath, Ouriel, Ozias, Saül.

column2: Johanan the father of Azariah (it was he who served as priest in the temple Solomon built in Jerusalem),
column3: Yohanani avyara Azariya (uwo ni we yakora igikorwa c’ubuherezi mu ngoro Salomo yubatse i Yerusalemu).
column4: Fils d’Elqana : Amasaï et Ahimoth.

column2: Azariah the father of Amariah, Amariah the father of Ahitub,
column3: Azariya avyara Amariya, Amariya avyara Ahitubu;
column4: Voici les descendants d’Elqana de père en fils : Tsophaï, Nahath,

column2: Ahitub the father of Zadok, Zadok the father of Shallum,
column3: Ahitubu avyara Sadoki, Sadoki avyara Shalumu;
column4: Eliab, Yeroham, Elqana et Samuel .

column2: Shallum the father of Hilkiah, Hilkiah the father of Azariah,
column3: Shalumu avyara Hilukiya, Hilukiya avyara Azariya;
column4: Fils de Samuel : Joël l’aîné, et Abiya le cadet.

column2: Azariah the father of Seraiah, and Seraiah the father of Jozadak.
column3: Azariya avyara Seraya, Seraya avyara Yehozadaki;
column4: Les descendants de Merari en ligne directe de père en fils furent : Mahli, Libni, Shimeï, Ouzza,

column2: Jozadak was deported when the Lord sent Judah and Jerusalem into exile by the hand of Nebuchadnezzar.
column3: Yehozadaki yambukanywe ar’ inyagano, igihe Uhoraho yatuma Nebukadineza kujana ab’ i Buyuda n’ab’i Yerusalemu ar’ inyagano.
column4: Shimea, Hagguiya et Asaya.

column2: The sons of Levi: Gershon, Kohath and Merari.
column3: Bene Lewi ni Gerushoni na Kohati na Merari.
column4: Voici les noms des lévites à qui David confia la responsabilité du chant dans le sanctuaire de l’Eternel, dès que le coffre y fut déposé.

column2: These are the names of the sons of Gershon: Libni and Shimei.
column3: Aya ni yo mazina ya bene Gerushoni: Libuni na Shimeyi.
column4: Ils exerçaient déjà leur service par le chant devant le tabernacle, la tente de la Rencontre, jusqu’à ce que Salomon ait bâti le temple de l’Eternel à Jérusalem, et ils exerçaient leur fonction d’après la règle qui leur avait été prescrite.

column2: The sons of Kohath: Amram, Izhar, Hebron and Uzziel.
column3: Bene Kohati ni Amuramu na Isihari na Heburoni na Uziyeli.
column4: Voici ceux qui accomplissaient ce service avec leurs fils. Parmi les Qehatites, Hémân officiait comme musicien. Ses ascendants en ligne directe étaient : Joël, Samuel ,

column2: The sons of Merari: Mahli and Mushi. These are the clans of the Levites listed according to their fathers:
column3: Bene Merari ni Mahili na Mushi. Kand’ iyi ni yo miryango y’Abalewi, nk’ukw amazu ya ba sekuruza ari.
column4: Elqana, Yeroham, Eliel, Toah,

column2: Of Gershon: Libni his son, Jahath his son, Zimmah his son,
column3: Aba Gerushoni, umuhungu wiwe ni Libuni, uwa Libuni ni Yahati, uwa Yahati ni Zima,
column4: Tsouph, Elqana, Mahath, Amasaï,

column2: Joah his son, Iddo his son, Zerah his son and Jeatherai his son.
column3: uwa Zima ni Yowa, uwa Yowa ni Ido, uwa Ido ni Zera, uwa Zera ni Yeyaterayi.
column4: Elqana, Joël, Azaria, Sophonie,

column2: The descendants of Kohath: Amminadab his son, Korah his son, Assir his son,
column3: Aba Kohati, umuhungu wiwe ni Aminadabu, uwa Aminadabu ni Kora, uwa Kora ni Asiri;
column4: Tahath, Assir, Ebyasaph, Qoré,

column2: Elkanah his son, Ebiasaph his son, Assir his son,
column3: uwa Asiri ni Elukana, uwa Elukana ni Ebiyasafu, uwa Ebiyasafu ni Asiri;
column4: Yitsehar, Qehath, Lévi, fils d’Israël.

column2: Tahath his son, Uriel his son, Uzziah his son and Shaul his son.
column3: uwa Asiri ni Tahati, uwa Tahati ni Uriyeli, uwa Uriyeli ni Uziya, uwa Uziya ni Shauli.
column4: A la droite de Hémân se tenait Asaph, membre de la même tribu, dont les ascendants de fils en père étaient Bérékia, Shimea,

column2: The descendants of Elkanah: Amasai, Ahimoth,
column3: Bene Elukana ni Amasayi na Ahimoti;
column4: Michaël, Baaséya, Malkiya,

column2: Elkanah his son, Zophai his son, Nahath his son,
column3: uwa Ahimoti ni Elukana, uwa Elukana ni Zofayi, uwa Zofayi ni Nahati;
column4: Etni, Zérah, Adaya,

column2: Eliab his son, Jeroham his son, Elkanah his son and Samuel his son.
column3: uwa Nahati ni Eliyabu, uwa Eliyabu ni Yerohamu, uwa Yerohamu ni Elukana.
column4: Etân, Zimma, Shimeï,

column2: The sons of Samuel: Joel the firstborn and Abijah the second son.
column3: Bene Samweli, imfura yiwe ni Yoweli, uwa kabiri ni Abiya.
column4: Yahath, Guershôn, fils de Lévi.

column2: The descendants of Merari: Mahli, Libni his son, Shimei his son, Uzzah his son,
column3: Aba Merari, umuhungu wiwe ni Mahili, uwa Mahili ni Libuni, uwa Libuni ni Shimeyi, uwa Shimeyi ni Uza;
column4: Sur la gauche se tenait Etân, des descendants de Merari, membres de la même tribu qu’eux. Les ascendants d’Etân en ligne directe étaient : Qishi, Abdi, Mallouk,

column2: Shimea his son, Haggiah his son and Asaiah his son.
column3: uwa Uza ni Shimeya, uwa Shimeya ni Hagiya, uwa Hagiya ni Asaya.
column4: Hashabia, Amatsia, Hilqiya,

column2: These are the men David put in charge of the music in the house of the Lord after the ark came to rest there.
column3: Aba ni bo Dawidi yashizeho ngo baganze ivyo kuririmba mu ngoro y’Uhoraho, isandugu y’ Uhoraho imaze kuhahabga uburuhukiro,
column4: Amtsi, Bani, Shémer,

column2: They ministered with music before the tabernacle, the tent of meeting, until Solomon built the temple of the Lord in Jerusalem. They performed their duties according to the regulations laid down for them.
column3: bagashitsa igikorwa cabo co kuririmba imbere y’ihema, ari ryo hema ry’ibonaniro, gushitsa habonetse ingoro Salomo yubakiye Uhoraho i Yerusalemu; bagakora igikorwa cabo bakūranwa, nk’ukw ibihe vyabo biri.
column4: Mahli, Moushi, Merari, Lévi.

column2: Here are the men who served, together with their sons: From the Kohathites: Heman, the musician, the son of Joel, the son of Samuel,
column3: Aba ni bo bākora ico gikorwa, bo n’ abana babo: mu ba Kohati ni Hemani umuririmvyi, mwene Yoweli, Yoweli wa Samweli;
column4: Les autres lévites étaient affectés à toutes les autres tâches afférentes au sanctuaire de Dieu.

column2: the son of Elkanah, the son of Jeroham, the son of Eliel, the son of Toah,
column3: Samweli wa Elukana, Elukana wa Yerohamu, Yerohamu wa Eliyeli, Eliyeli wa Towa;
column4: Aaron et ses descendants offraient les sacrifices sur l’autel des holocaustes et les parfums sur l’autel des parfums ; ils accomplissaient toutes les tâches relatives au lieu très saint et faisaient le rite d’expiation pour Israël, conformément à tout ce qu’avait ordonné Moïse, serviteur de Dieu.

column2: the son of Zuph, the son of Elkanah, the son of Mahath, the son of Amasai,
column3: Towa wa Sufi, Sufi wa Elukana, Elukana wa Mahati, Mahati wa Amasayi;
column4: Voici la liste des descendants d’Aaron de père en fils : Eléazar, Phinéas, Abishoua,

column2: the son of Elkanah, the son of Joel, the son of Azariah, the son of Zephaniah,
column3: Amasayi wa Elukana, Elukana wa Yoweli, Yoweli wa Azariya, Azariya wa Zefaniya;
column4: Bouqqi, Ouzzi, Zerahya,

column2: the son of Tahath, the son of Assir, the son of Ebiasaph, the son of Korah,
column3: Zefaniya wa Tahati, Tahati wa Asiri, Asiri wa Ebiyasafu, Ebiyasafu wa Kora;
column4: Merayoth, Amaria, Ahitoub,

column2: the son of Izhar, the son of Kohath, the son of Levi, the son of Israel;
column3: Kora wa Isuhari, Isuhari wa Kohati, Kohati wa Lewi, Lewi wa Isirayeli.
column4: Tsadoq et Ahimaats.

column2: and Heman’s associate Asaph, who served at his right hand: Asaph son of Berekiah, the son of Shimea,
column3: Hāri na Asafu mugenzi we, yahagarara i buryo bgiwe; Asafu uwo, ni we mwene Berekiya, Berekiya wa Shimeya;
column4: Voici la liste des territoires avec leurs enclos attribués aux descendants d’Aaron, de la famille des Qehatites, auxquels fut attribué par le sort un lot :

column2: the son of Michael, the son of Baaseiah, the son of Malkijah,
column3: Shimeya wa Mikayeli, Mikayeli wa Bayaseya, Bayaseya wa Malukiya;
column4: Hébron, dans le pays de Juda, avec les terres attenantes ;

column2: the son of Ethni, the son of Zerah, the son of Adaiah,
column3: Malukiya wa Etuni, Etuni wa Zera, Zera wa Adaya;
column4: mais les champs et les villages qui dépendaient de la ville furent donnés à Caleb, fils de Yephounné .

column2: the son of Ethan, the son of Zimmah, the son of Shimei,
column3: Adaya wa Etani, Etani wa Zima, Zima wa Shimeyi;
column4: On donna aux descendants d’Aaron Hébron, la ville de refuge , et les villes suivantes avec leurs terres attenantes : Libna, Yattir, Eshtemoa,

column2: the son of Jahath, the son of Gershon, the son of Levi;
column3: Shimeyi wa Yahati, Yahati wa Gerushoni, Gerushoni wa Lewi.
column4: Hilên, Debir,

column2: and from their associates, the Merarites, at his left hand: Ethan son of Kishi, the son of Abdi, the son of Malluk,
column3: Kand’ i bumoso bgabo hāri bagenzi babo bo mu ba Merari; Etani mwene Kishi, Kishi wa Abudi, Abudi wa Maluki;
column4: Ashân , Beth-Shémesh.

column2: the son of Hashabiah, the son of Amaziah, the son of Hilkiah,
column3: Maluki wa Hashabiya, Hashabiya wa Amaziya, Amaziya wa Hilukiya;
column4: Dans le territoire de la tribu de Benjamin, ils reçurent, avec leurs terres attenantes : Guéba, Allémeth, Anatoth. Ils reçurent donc au total treize villes réparties entre leurs familles.

column2: the son of Amzi, the son of Bani, the son of Shemer,
column3: Hilukiya wa Amusi, Amusi wa Bani, Bani wa Shemeri;
column4: Les autres Qehatites obtinrent par tirage au sort dix villes situées dans les territoires des familles de la tribu [d’Ephraïm, de la tribu de Dan et ] de la demi-tribu de Manassé .

column2: the son of Mahli, the son of Mushi, the son of Merari, the son of Levi.
column3: Shemeri wa Mahili, Mahili wa Mushi, Mushi wa Merari, Merari wa Lewi.
column4: Les Guershonites obtinrent pour leurs familles treize villes situées dans les territoires des tribus d’Issacar, d’Aser, de Nephtali et de la tribu de Manassé établie dans le Basan.

column2: Their fellow Levites were assigned to all the other duties of the tabernacle, the house of God.
column3: Kand’ abandi bagenzi babo b’Abalewi bāri bashizweho gukora ibikorwa vyose vy’iryo hema, ari yo ngoro y’Imana.
column4: Les Merarites reçurent pour leurs familles, par tirage au sort, douze villes situées dans les territoires des tribus de Ruben, de Gad et de Zabulon.

column2: But Aaron and his descendants were the ones who presented offerings on the altar of burnt offering and on the altar of incense in connection with all that was done in the Most Holy Place, making atonement for Israel, in accordance with all that Moses the servant of God had commanded.
column3: Ariko Aroni n’abana biwe, ivyabo kwar’ ukwosa ibimazi ku gicaniro vyoserezwako, no kwosa imibavu ku gicaniro cayo, bagakora ibikorwa vyose vy’Ahēra cane, bagatangira Abisirayeli impongano, vyose babigenjeje nk’uko Mose umusavyi w’Imana yageze.
column4: Les Israélites attribuèrent ces villes et les terres attenantes aux lévites.

column2: These were the descendants of Aaron: Eleazar his son, Phinehas his son, Abishua his son,
column3: Aba ni bo ba Aroni: umuhungu wiwe ni Eleyazari, uwa Eleyazari ni Finehasi, uwa Finehasi ni Abishuwa;
column4: Ils attribuèrent par tirage au sort ces villes désignées par leur nom et situées dans le territoire des tribus de Juda, de Siméon et de Benjamin.

column2: Bukki his son, Uzzi his son, Zerahiah his son,
column3: uwa Abishuwa ni Buki, uwa Buki ni Uzi, uwa Uzi ni Zerahiya;
column4: Les autres familles des Qehatites obtinrent pour domaine des villes situées dans le territoire de la tribu d’Ephraïm

column2: Meraioth his son, Amariah his son, Ahitub his son,
column3: uwa Zerahiya ni Merayoti, uwa Merayoti ni Amariya, uwa Amariya ni Ahitubu;
column4: avec leurs terres attenantes : Sichem, la ville de refuge, dans la région montagneuse d’Ephraïm, Guézer,

column2: Zadok his son and Ahimaaz his son.
column3: uwa Ahitubu ni Sadoki, uwa Sadoki ni Ahimasi.
column4: Yoqmeam, Beth-Horôn,

column2: These were the locations of their settlements allotted as their territory (they were assigned to the descendants of Aaron who were from the Kohathite clan, because the first lot was for them):
column3: Aha ni ho bāhawe ho kuba, nk’ukw amatongo yabo ari mu ntāra zabo: mu mazu y’Abakohati, aba Aroni ni bo ubupfindo bgatanguye kwerekana;
column4: Ayalôn, Gath-Rimmôn.

column2: They were given Hebron in Judah with its surrounding pasturelands.
column3: babaha Heburoni mu ntāra y’Abayuda, n’amaragiro ahakikije;
column4: Dans le territoire de la demi-tribu de Manassé, ils reçurent, avec leurs terres attenantes : Aner et Bileam. Voilà ce que reçurent les autres familles des descendants de Qehath.

column2: But the fields and villages around the city were given to Caleb son of Jephunneh.
column3: arikw indimiro zo kur’ ico gisagara, n’ imihana ihakūkira, babiha Kalebu mwene Yefune.
column4: Les descendants de Guershôn reçurent : dans le territoire des familles de la demi-tribu de Manassé les villes suivantes, avec leurs terres attenantes : Golân, dans le Basan, et Ashtaroth.

column2: So the descendants of Aaron were given Hebron (a city of refuge), and Libnah, Jattir, Eshtemoa,
column3: Kand’ aba Aroni babaha n’ibisagara vy’ubuhungiro: i Heburoni nyene, n’i Libuna n’amaragiro yaho, n’i Yatiri, n’i Eshitemowa;
column4: Dans le territoire de la tribu d’Issacar, ils reçurent, avec leurs terres attenantes : Qédesh, Dobrath,

column2: Hilen, Debir,
column3: n’i Hilene, n’i Debira;
column4: Ramoth et Anem.

column2: Ashan, Juttah and Beth Shemesh, together with their pasturelands.
column3: n’i Ashani, n’i Beti‐shemeshi, bo n’amaragiro bigendanye;
column4: Dans le territoire de la tribu d’Aser, avec leurs terres attenantes : Mashal, Abdôn,

column2: And from the tribe of Benjamin they were given Gibeon, Geba, Alemeth and Anathoth, together with their pasturelands. The total number of towns distributed among the Kohathite clans came to thirteen.
column3: kandi ku bisagara vy’umuryango w’Ababenyamini batanga Geba n’i Alemeti n’i Anatoti, bo n’amaragiro bigendanye. Ibisagara vyabo vyose na vyose, guhetūra amazu yabo, vyar’ icumi na bitatu.
column4: Houqoq et Rehob.

column2: The rest of Kohath’s descendants were allotted ten towns from the clans of half the tribe of Manasseh.
column3: Kand’ abandi bo mu ba Kohati, ibisagara bāhawe n’ubupfindo vyar’ icumi, vyākūwe ku vy’umuryango w’ Abefurayimu no ku vy’uw’ Abadani, no ku vy’igihimba c’umuryango w’Abamanase.
column4: Et dans le territoire de la tribu de Nephtali : Qédesh en Galilée et les terres attenantes, Hammôn et les terres attenantes et Qiryataïm et les terres attenantes.

column2: The descendants of Gershon, clan by clan, were allotted thirteen towns from the tribes of Issachar, Asher and Naphtali, and from the part of the tribe of Manasseh that is in Bashan.
column3: Aba Gerushoni, nk’ukw amazu yabo ari, bahabga ibisagara cumi na bitatu, bikūwe ku vy’ umuryango w’Abisakari no ku vy’ uw’ Abasheri no ku vy’uw’ Abanafutali no ku vy’uw’ Abamanase i Bashani.
column4: Le reste des Merarites reçurent, dans le territoire de la tribu de Zabulon , les villes suivantes avec leurs terres attenantes : Rimmono, Thabor.

column2: The descendants of Merari, clan by clan, were allotted twelve towns from the tribes of Reuben, Gad and Zebulun.
column3: Aba Merari, nk’ukw amazu yabo ari, ibisagara bāhawe n’ubupfindo vyar’ icumi na bibiri, vyākūwe ku vy’umuryango w’Abareyubeni no ku vy’uw’ Abagadi no ku vy’uw’ Abazebuloni.
column4: En Transjordanie, en face de Jéricho, à l’est du Jourdain, dans le territoire de la tribu de Ruben, ils reçurent, avec leurs terres attenantes : Bétser au désert, Yahats,

column2: So the Israelites gave the Levites these towns and their pasturelands.
column3: Uko ni kw Abisirayeli bāhaye Abalewi ibisagara, bo n’amaragiro bigendanye.
column4: Qedémoth, Méphaath.

column2: From the tribes of Judah, Simeon and Benjamin they allotted the previously named towns.
column3: Kandi babahesha ubupfindo ivyo bisagara vyadōnzwe amazina, bikūwe ku vy’umuryango w’Abayuda no ku vy’uw’ Abasimeyoni no ku vy’uw’ Ababenyamini.
column4: Et dans le territoire de la tribu de Gad, avec leurs terres attenantes : Ramoth en Galaad, Mahanaïm,

column2: Some of the Kohathite clans were given as their territory towns from the tribe of Ephraim.
column3: Kand’ amazu amwe y’aba Kohati bari bafise ibisagara mu ntāra yabo bikūwe ku vy’umuryango w’Abefurayimu.
column4: Heshbôn et Yaezer.

column2: In the hill country of Ephraim they were given Shechem (a city of refuge), and Gezer,
column3: Babaha n’ibisagara vy’ubuhungiro, babaha Shekemu n’amaragiro yaho mu mugamba w’Abefurayimu nyene, bo n’i Gezeri n’amaragiro yaho,

column2: Jokmeam, Beth Horon,
column3: na Yokimeyamu na Beti‐horoni,

column2: Aijalon and Gath Rimmon, together with their pasturelands.
column3: na Ayaloni na Gatirimoni, bo n’amaragiro bigendanye.

column2: And from half the tribe of Manasseh the Israelites gave Aner and Bileam, together with their pasturelands, to the rest of the Kohathite clans.
column3: Ku vy’igihimba c’umuryango w’Abamanase babaha Aneri n’amaragiro yaho, na Bileyamu n’amaragiro yaho, ngo bibe ivy’ amazu asigaye y’aba Kohati.

column2: The Gershonites received the following: From the clan of the half-tribe of Manasseh they received Golan in Bashan and also Ashtaroth, together with their pasturelands;
column3: Aba Gerushoni bahabga ibisagara bikūwe ku vy’igihimba c’ umuryango w’Abamanase nyene, ni vyo ibi: Golani i Bashani n’ amaragiro yaho, na Ashitaroti n’ amaragiro yaho;

column2: from the tribe of Issachar they received Kedesh, Daberath,
column3: ku vy’umuryango w’Abisakari babaha Kedeshi na Daberati,

column2: Ramoth and Anem, together with their pasturelands;
column3: na Ramoti na Anemu, bo n’amaragiro bigendanye;

column2: from the tribe of Asher they received Mashal, Abdon,
column3: ku vy’umuryango w’Abasheri babaha Mashali na Abudoni,

column2: Hukok and Rehob, together with their pasturelands;
column3: na Hukoki na Rehobu, bo n’amaragiro bigendanye;

column2: and from the tribe of Naphtali they received Kedesh in Galilee, Hammon and Kiriathaim, together with their pasturelands.
column3: ku vy’umuryango w’Abanafutali babaha Kedeshi i Galilaya na Hamoni na Kiriyatayimu, bo n’amaragiro bigendanye.
